result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Victor M Pineda was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Victor M Pineda was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ozaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine/costs during term of extended supervision. Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to attend Victim Impact Program.

8/17/2015 Trial
   Exhibit 2 - CD located in Exhibit CD/DVD binder
Exhibits located in Exhibit room FC 1-3
Guilty-Ct. 1 Guilty Ct. 2
Stipulation and Order for return/destruction of exhibits
Jury welcome

Spanish Interpreter-John Vaughn & Vicki Bermudez-given oath/ Defendant appears in custody and by Atty. Sergio Magana. District Attorney Adam Gerol appears for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel stipulations read into the record.
  9:08 am   Jurors reported and given oath.
  9:09 am   20 jurors called to jury box.
  9:12 am   Voir dire by court. 
  9:36 am   Voir dire by Atty. Gerol.
  9:48 am   Voir dire by Atty. Magano.
  9:50 am   Counsel striking of jury.
  9:55 am   12 jurors called to hear case. All other jurors thanked and excused.
  9:58 am   Jury given oath.
  9:59 am   Jury/Court recess.
10:18 am   Opening statement by Atty. Gerol.
10:28 am   Opening statement by Atty. Magana.
10:32 am   Deputy Bradley Arndt sworn and testified. Exam by Atty. Gerol, crossexam, redirect.
10:58 am   Jury recess.
11:25 am   Court in session. Interpreter John Vaughn informs the Court he has viewed the video.
11:26 am   Jury in court. Video (exhibit #2) played for jury.
11:44 am   Lunch recess until 1:00 pm.
  1:05 pm   Court in session. Court examines defendant as to his right to testify. Defendant elects not to testify.
  1:12 pm   Jury in court. Deputy Bradley Arndt resumes stand. Adverse exam by Atty. Magana, exam by Atty. Magana.
  1:18 pm   Defense rests. No rebuttal of State. 
  1:19 pm   Jury excused, jury instruction / verdict conference held.
  1:40 pm   Closing statement by Atty. Gerol.
  1:48 pm   Closing statement by Atty. Magana.
  1:50 pm   Court instructs jury.
  2:05 pm   Bailiff sworn. 
  2:07 pm   Jury leaves for deliberation.
  2:12 pm   Court is informed verdict has been reached.
  2:22 pm   Court/counsel/jury in court. Verdict Read:  Ct. 1-Guilty   Ct. 2-Guilty
  2:25 pm   Jury polled.
  2:26 pm   Jury thanked and excused. Court grants State's motion for judgment on the verdict, denied Atty. Magana's motion notwithstanding the verdict.
                    On request of Atty. Magana, Court orders a presentence report be filed.  Sentencing adjourned to 8/17/2015 at 3:45 pm.
